description: End users may experience unexpected exposure of sensitive information when using Windows Remote Access Connection Manager. This issue can manifest as unintentional data leaks during active remote sessions, which could compromise user privacy. Affected build numbers include 10.0.19045.4291, 10.0.19044.4291, and 10.0.22631.3447, among others. The underlying problem is linked to an information disclosure vulnerability, identifiable through KB Articles KB-5036925, KB-5036910, and others. System administrators should be particularly vigilant in environments where remote access is prevalent, as this symptom directly affects user trust and data security.
